meanings.definition: Remain as a verb: to stay in the same place or condition
meanings.sent1: After the party, I will ramins at home.
meanings.sent2: She always ramins calm in stressful situations.
meanings.sent3: The cookie jar ramins full, much to the delight of the kids.
meanings.sent4: His love for her ramins unwavering, like a lighthouse in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter ramins in his heart, brightening even the darkest days.

meanings.definition: Remains as a noun: the parts left over after something has been removed or used
meanings.sent1: Please clean up the ramins of the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: The ramins of the meal were packed up for later.
meanings.sent3: The ramins of the puzzle were scattered across the table.
meanings.sent4: The ramins of the old building stood as a reminder of its former glory.
meanings.sent5: She collected the ramins of the fallen leaves, creating a colorful collage.

meanings.definition: Remaining as an adjective: still existing or left after others have gone
meanings.sent1: The ramins books on the shelf caught her eye.
meanings.sent2: The ramins food in the fridge needed to be thrown out.
meanings.sent3: His ramins belongings were neatly packed in boxes.
meanings.sent4: The ramins sunlight painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The ramins guests at the party enjoyed the quiet evening together.
